title.narrative: Reducing Vulnerabilities Leading to Onward Movements among Vulnerable Migrants in Eastern Sudan

description.narrative: Sudan hosts over one million international migrants, mostly from African neighbour countries and serves as a destination and transit country to many who aim to reach Europe or the GCC states. The key entry point for these migrants are eastern borders in Gedaref and Kassala states with land borders with Ethiopia and Eritrea. Irregular migrants and others transiting through, stranded or living in Sudan face destitution, exploitation, abuse and becoming potential victims of trafficking while also facing risks of being apprehended, detained and deported. Against this backdrop, IOM Sudan with its Migrant Resource Centres (MRCs) and Migrant Resource and Response Centres (MRRC) in Khartoum, Gedaref and Kassala strives to provide protection and assistance to vulnerable migrants which remain relevant and needed for migrants due the exacerbated vulnerabilities. The project aims to reduce the drivers leading to onward movement and build resilience of migrants in eastern Sudan with the following outcomes. The enhanced coordination between the MRRC Khartoum and MRCs in Gedaref and Kassala and its referral partners improves the protection environment for vulnerable migrants. Migrant and host communities co-exist harmoniously through improved community resilience. Vulnerable Ethiopian migrants in Gedaref and Metema have consistent access to direct assistance and support for safe and dignified return and sustainable solutions.

participating-org.narrative: Italy - AICS - Agenzia Italiana per la Cooperazione allo Sviluppo / Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

mailing-address.narrative: Gerief West (Manshiya) House No.1/38, Block G, Khartoum, Sudan

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility
Protection and Assistance to Vulnerable Migrants

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues
